intro: Ranunculus alismifolius var. montanus, commonly known as the alpine buttercup, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to alpine regions of Europe. It features a basal rosette of finely divided, bright green leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. The plant produces showy yellow flowers with prominent yellow anthers and a hairy receptacle. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and mountainous habitats. Due to its delicate structure, it is adapted to withstand cold temperatures and strong winds.
